intro: Anthemis plebeia, commonly known as common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange flower heads that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, and it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Anthemis plebeia is also known for its strong, aromatic scent and has been used historically in folk medicine.
